snippet: Detroit’s hopes for a swift emergence from the nation’s largest municipal bankruptcy remain uncertain, despite the fact that it gained the support of a former opponent.
abstract: Detroit announces final settlement with Syncora Guarantee, creditor that had been one of its chief adversaries, as other creditors continue to object city's bankruptcy plans.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Detroit, and Mary Williams Walsh from New York.

lead_paragraph: Detroit’s hopes for a swift emergence from the nation’s largest municipal bankruptcy remain uncertain, despite the fact that it gained the support of a former opponent.

headline.main: Detroit Reaches Deal With Creditor, as Others Object to Bankruptcy Plans
headline.print_headline: Detroit Reaches Deal With Creditor, as Others Object to Bankruptcy Plans
